data.title: ASOS
data.text:
What is ASOS?

The Automated Surface Observing Systems (ASOS) is a Tri-Agency Program consisting of the National Weather Service (NWS), the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), and the Department of Defense (DOD).

ASOS serves as the nation's primary surface weather observing network.

ASOS is designed to support aviation operations at both large and small airports and support the needs of the meteorological, hydrological, and climatological research communities.

ASOS primary support components for over thousand locations for surface weather.

ASOS advises air traffic management of the current weather conditions in support of the national airspace, safety of the flying public and Navy, Marine Corps, and Army operational airfields.
